articles.title: Argentina says growers have sold 31.9 mln tonnes of 2020/21 soy
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Oct 20 (Reuters) - Argentine farmers have sold 31.9 million tonnes of soybeans harvested in the 2020/21 season, the Agriculture Ministry said on Wednesday in a report with data updated through Oct.
articles.content:
BUENOS AIRES, Oct 20 (Reuters) - Argentine farmers have sold 31.9 million tonnes of soybeans harvested in the 2020/21 season, the Agriculture Ministry said on Wednesday in a report with data updated through Oct. 13.

articles.title: Supply disruption to China gives hope to Australian beef exporters
articles.description: China faces a beef shortage if restrictions remain on imports from Brazil and Argentina – which could be good news for Australian farmers.
articles.content:
The price of Australian beef was also expected to become more attractive once supply chain issues caused by the global pandemic were resolved going into next year.

articles.title: Argentina freezes goods prices after talks break down
articles.description: The standoff threatens to inflame tensions between the business sector and the government, which is looking to bolster its popularity ahead of the November legislative vote, when it is expected to face losses in Congress. COPAL earlier said the food and beverage industry was "willing to reach an agreement on price freezes" but called for "genuine dialogue instead of unilateral decisions."
articles.content:
Argentina's government froze prices of over a thousand household goods until early 2022 on Tuesday in a bid to tamp down inflation, pushing the measure through by force after talks with the country's main food industry chamber broke down.
The center-... [1937 chars]

articles.title: Argentina food chamber knocks back government prize freeze plan
articles.description: COPAL said the food and beverage industry was "willing to reach an agreement on price freezes" but called for "genuine dialogue instead of unilateral decisions." "We continue to hope that an agreement can be reached," said presidential spokeswoman Gabriela Cerruti, adding the government was looking at proposals and modifications.
articles.content:
Argentina's umbrella food industry chamber said on Tuesday that a government proposal to freeze prices on some 1,650 food and household goods fell short of an offer the sector could accept and criticized officials for pushing a one-sided deal.
The st... [1830 chars]

articles.title: Argentina food chamber knocks back government prize freeze plan
articles.description:
Argentina's umbrella food industry chamber said on Tuesday that a government proposal to freeze prices on some 1,650 food and household goods fell short of an offer the sector could accept and criticized officials for pushing a one-sided deal.
COPAL, however, said in a statement that the call from the government for price freezes did not give the food and beverage sector enough guarantees.
